aka: Burn Aloe, First Aid Plant, True Aloe (vera means true or genuine)
description: Green to grey-green, sometimes with white flecks. Cultivated for agricultural and medicinal purposes
flowers: produced on spike up to 90cm, pendulous flowers with yellow tubular corolla

aka: Jade plant, Lucky plant, Money tree
description: evergreen, thick branches, smooth leaves in opposing pairs
flowers: small, white or pink, star shaped, blooming in fall

description: a variety of succulent species - bulbous leaves opposite each other, hardly any stem.
flowers: yellow or white, usually in autumn, sweetly scented
fruit: a dry capsule that opens when it gets wet, closes again when dry.  May detach, or disintigrate after a few years
growth_pattern: a single pair of leaves per plant
height: stay close to ground, are mostly burried

description: Not cold hardy.  Propogation by leaf cuttings.  Non toxic to humans and animals. Not suited for indoor growing
club shaped light green leaves clustered at branch tips
flowers: barely open with greenish yellow petals and long green sepals - late winter

description: round blue spatula shaped leaves comprising rosettes, enjoys shade
mats of tufted leaves forming monocarpic rosettes.  Sometimes confused with Echeveria.
flowers: hermaphroditic, reddish, yellowish, pinkish, seldom whitish
origin: Morocco to Iran, mountains of Iberia, Alps, Carpathians, Balkan mountains, Turkey, Sahara Desert
